48:09 Caption: Danny Makkelie has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
48:59 Caption: Up to now the match has suffered in terms of attractiveness as the game has been devoid of any interesting moments. The home side dominated the first half in most aspects of the game, but the visitors will surely attempt to turn the situation around in the second half. The home team is playing possession football and the away team is basing its game on a well-organized defence.

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The game between Bayer Leverkusen and BATE Borisov took place under clear skies at the BayArena, a crucial fixture in the group stage of the UEFA Champions League. Both teams stepped onto the pitch with determination, looking to secure vital points. From the very start, Bayer Leverkusen took the initiative, and their proactive approach was evident right from the kickoff.

The game commenced with Bayer Leverkusen in possession, promptly initiating an attack. By the third minute, the home team managed to create the first significant opportunity of the match. A well-coordinated offensive move culminated in a shot on target, and within moments, the ball found the back of the net, giving Bayer Leverkusen an early lead. The scorer was embraced by his teammates as the crowd erupted in applause.

BATE, undeterred, reset and tried to find their rhythm. However, the match saw several disruptions with balls going out of play, resulting in multiple throw-ins. Nonetheless, BATE persevered and managed a clearance in the eighth minute, alleviating some of the pressure.

In the tenth minute, BATE's Igor Stasevich attempted to dribble past an opposing player but ended up winning a corner for his team. Stasevich took the corner, and it found Nemanja Milunovic, who leapt higher than everyone else to head the ball into the goal successfully. The game was level at 1-1, and BATE were right back into it. Both teams then embarked on a series of tactical battles, with Bayer Leverkusen committing an offside and having multiple throw-ins. Chicharito showcased his individual brilliance in the 16th minute with an admirable attempt, but his shot was blocked by a BATE defender.

Consequently, the game turned into a midfield tussle with both sides committing fouls and earning indirect free-kicks. The twenty-first minute saw Lars Bender and Kevin Kampl trying to exploit spaces to create opportunities. Despite their efforts, Bayer Leverkusen failed to convert chances, barely missing the target several times. Admir Mehmedi came close but could not capitalize, missing the right post narrowly.

Contrary to normal proceedings, BATE had to make an early substitution in the 29th minute when Aljaksandr Hleb was replaced by Aleksandr Volodko due to injury. Matters grew tense in the dying moments of the first half, with both sides receiving yellow cards. Kyriakos Papadopoulos from Bayer Leverkusen was booked for a foul, and shortly after, BATE's Dmitri Baga saw yellow for a tough tackle. Lars Bender was replaced by Christoph Kramer as his injury concern grew.

As the first half neared its conclusion, Bayer Leverkusen exerted immense pressure on BATE's goal. Their persistence paid off when Christoph Kramer moved towards the goal, creating a chance, only to be thwarted by BATE’s resilient defense. Despite maintaining majority possession, Bayer Leverkusen was unable to capitalize on their extended pressing, as Sergey Chernik made some crucial saves to keep the scoreline even at the halftime whistle.

After the halftime break, the second half kicked off with renewed energy. Almost immediately, Bayer Leverkusen regained control. Karim Bellarabi quickly passed the ball to Hakan Calhanoglu, who fired a shot from the edge of the box. The ball deflected into the goal, leaving Sergey Chernik helpless. It was quick as lightning, and Bayer Leverkusen found themselves leading 2-1 just a minute into the second half. 

Bayer Leverkusen continued their attacking ferocity. Barely had the spectators settled when Bellarabi again made an impact. This time, he sent a precise ball to Chicharito, who adeptly finished with a clinical effort into the bottom left corner, extending the home team's lead to 3-1 within the first fifteen minutes of the second half. This goal appeared to demoralize BATE, prompting them to make another substitution as Dmitri Baga was replaced by Aleksandr Karnitskiy.

Despite the scoreline, BATE didn’t surrender. They tried multiple counters and worked hard to find openings, but the steadfast defense of Bayer Leverkusen made it hard for them to make headway. Igor Stasevich, again in action, crossed the ball into the box but failed to connect with his teammates. Chicharito, a constant threat, came close once more, but his effort was heroically saved by Chernik.

As the match progressed into the thirtieth minute, the referee awarded a penalty to Bayer Leverkusen after a handball by Filip Mladenovic. Hakan Calhanoglu stepped up to take the penalty and made no mistake, sending Chernik the wrong way and making it 4-1 in favour of Bayer Leverkusen. The tempo of the game remained intense, with regular fouls and stoppages. Julian Brandt substituted Hakan Calhanoglu, while BATE also made another change, bringing on Maksim Volodjko.

The substitutions did bring some fresh legs and energy, but it seemed too little too late for BATE. Bayer Leverkusen's control over the game was evident, and they primarily held onto the ball, ensuring their lead was secure. In the final minutes of the game, BATE's Nikolai Signevich was booked for a heavy challenge, symbolizing the frustration of the visiting side.

The full-time whistle blew after four minutes of added time, concluding the game at 4-1. As the fans celebrated enthusiastically, it was clear that Bayer Leverkusen's dominance, both in possession and in pressing high up the pitch, paid off. Despite a valiant effort by Sergey Chernik and an organized BATE defense, Bayer Leverkusen's relentless assault and clinical finishing ensured they walked away with all three points. 

The attendance of 24,280 at the BayArena witnessed a thorough display of football prowess from the hosts, with moments of brilliance, tactical finesse, and solid defensive work contributing to an entertaining and decisive victory. While BATE made commendable efforts and had a few good moments, it was Bayer Leverkusen who dictated the match tempo, executing their game plan flawlessly and securing a well-deserved win in this Champions League encounter.
